page.title: 07Schools
page.content:
There was a small free school for the poor children in the area in 1811. This school was established by the Turner family.
In 1866 a new school was built by Mrs Newcomen who also paid for the Parish Church. Then in 1876 the management of the school was taken over by the Kirkleatham School Board and then by the Church. The Coatham Church of England school was used as a school until 1969 when it, together with Warrenby School, was closed. A new Primary School was built 200 yards away.
This school was opened by the Archbishop of York on October 10th 1969. At present there are 198 children and 7 teachers. The Headmaster is Mr. T. Reeve.
